attributes.action: Petition for the NHS to Screen Pregnant Women for CMV (Cytomegalovirus)
attributes.additional_details:
introducing routine CMV screening, could:

Increase Early Detection: Early identification of CMV infections could allow pregnant women to take preventive measures,
Reduce the Risk of Severe Outcomes
Raise Awareness
Improve Public Health:
attributes.background: Call upon the National Health Service (NHS) to introduce routine screening for Cytomegalovirus (CMV) in all pregnant women, in order to prevent the risks and potential long-term effects of congenital CMV infection.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petition, which calls for similar action:

Fund screening for cytomegalovirus (CMV) in pregnancy and further research.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/708743
